alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 11 at 5:53PM EST until November 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Extensive flooding from heavy rainfall earlier today is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Ashe and Watauga. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Extensive minor to locally moderate flooding continues, and numerous roads and low water crossings remain closed. As of 530 pm, local stream gauges are indicating that water rises are beginning to slow down, and many streams are likely to crest by 7 pm. However, it will take at least into early Saturday for all the water to work through local drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain has exited the area, with only light to occasionally moderate rainfall remaining. Flooding has been ongoing in the warned area through the day. - Locations experiencing flooding include... Blowing Rock, Beech Mountain, Todd, Deep Gap, Sugar Grove and Foscoe. Significant flooding is occurring along the Watauga River in the communities of Valle Crucis and Sugar Grove, with water covering roads and surrounding nearby homes.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be cautious at night when flooding is more difficult to see. Please send your reports of flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
